thread.title: Tennessee at Alabama by the numbers: Tide goes for 9 in a row - AL.com
thread.title_full: Tennessee at Alabama by the numbers: Tide goes for 9 in a row - AL.com

title: Tennessee at Alabama by the numbers: Tide goes for 9 in a row - AL.com
text:
Tennessee (3-3, 1-2) at No. 8 Alabama (6-1, 3-1) 
2:30 p.m. CDT Saturday (CBS) 
Bryant-Denny Stadium, Tuscaloosa 
0 Victories in nine road games against ranked opponents for teams coached by Tennessee's Butch Jones, who is in his ninth season as a collegiate head coach. He's 0-7 at Tennessee. 
1 Victory for the SEC East in seven games against the SEC West this season. The East's only interdivision victory this season is Florida's 38-10 win over Ole Miss on Oct. 3. Alabama has a 47-19-1 record against the SEC East. Tennessee has a 36-30-1 record against the SEC West. 
4 Of Alabama's 2015 opponents will be coming off open dates when they face the Crimson Tide, including Tennessee. The others are Louisiana-Monroe, Texas A&M and LSU. 
5 Consecutive seasons with a 3-3 record for Tennessee. In three of the previous four years, the Volunteers lost their seventh game. 
6 Points have been scored in the first quarter against Alabama this season. Only Duke, which has given up three, has yielded fewer first-quarter points than the Crimson Tide this season. Alabama has outscored its opponents 41-6 in the opening period in 2015. Tennessee has outscored its opponents 65-31 in the first quarter. 
8 Consecutive victories for Alabama against Tennessee. The Volunteers haven't beaten the Tide since a 16-13 victory on Oct. 21, 2006. This is the 72 nd consecutive season that Alabama and Tennessee have squared off. 
9 Consecutive losses against SEC West teams on the road for Tennessee. The Volunteers haven't posted a victory in a Western Division team's home stadium since they defeated Mississippi State 33-21 in Starkville on Oct. 13, 2007. Tennessee's most recent victory in Tuscaloosa is a 51-43 win in five overtimes on Oct. 25, 2003. 
10 Consecutive losses have been suffered by Tennessee in games against SEC West teams. The Volunteers' opponents during the streak had a combined record of 60-6 at the time of the game. Tennessee hasn't beaten a team from the Western Division since topping Ole Miss 52-14 on Nov. 13, 2010. 
12 Consecutive losses in October road games for Tennessee. The Volunteers haven't won away from Neyland Stadium in the 10 th month since a 33-21 victory at Mississippi State on Oct. 13, 2007. 
12 Consecutive Alabama games have included a rushing TD scored by RB Derrick Henry, a school record and the nation's longest active streak. Since being kept out of the end zone during last year's game against LSU, Henry has run for 19 TDs. 
13 Consecutive victories over SEC East opponents for Alabama. The Tide's most recent defeat by an Eastern Division foe is a 35-21 setback against South Carolina on Oct. 9, 2010. 
22 Consecutive losses in road games against ranked teams for Tennessee. The Volunteers' most recent victory in a ranked team's stadium is a 51-33 win at No. 10 Georgia on Oct. 7, 2006. 
FOR MORE OF OUR COMPREHENSIVE COVERAGE OF THE SEC, GO TO OUR SEC PAGE 
22 First downs have been gained on the ground by Alabama's opponents, the fewest in the nation. 
24 Consecutive losses for Tennessee in games against teams in the top 10 of the AP poll. The Volunteers' most recent victory over a top-10 opponent is a 51-33 win against No. 10 Georgia on Oct. 7, 2006. 
37.25 Yards averaged per kickoff return by Tennessee this season, the best figure in the nation. Evan Berry's kickoff-return average of 39.3 yards is the best in the nation for any player with more than seven returns, and he's one of four players in the nation who has returned two kickoffs for TDs in 2015. 
47 Passes have been broken up by Alabama defensive players this season, the most in the nation. Add the Tide's 12 interceptions and Alabama's 59 passes defended also leads the nation. 
57 Consecutive victories in games against unranked teams for Alabama. The Crimson Tide's most recent defeat by an unranked team came on Nov. 17, 2007, when Louisiana-Monroe upended Alabama 21-14. 
110 Games have been played by Alabama since the Crimson Tide failed to score in the first half, the longest streak in the nation. On Sept. 29, 2007, Alabama and Florida State headed into halftime tied at 0-0. The Seminoles won the game 21-14. The Tide has scored in the first half of every game since. Alabama has a 94-16 record during the streak. 
123 Consecutive AP poll appearances have been made by Alabama, the longest active streak in the nation. Florida State is next on the list with 61. The Crimson Tide's streak is the 11 th -longest of all-time and the second-longest in SEC history behind Florida's 209-poll streak of 1989 through 2001. 
190 Consecutive games without being shut out for Alabama, a school record. Alabama's most recent shutout came 9-0 to Auburn on Nov. 18, 2000. 
236 Rushing yards were gained by Alabama RB Derrick Henry during the Crimson Tide's 41-23 victory over Texas A&M last week, the fourth time in the past nine games that Henry has set a career high. He had 141 rushing yards against Missouri in last year's SEC championship game, then ran for 147 against Wisconsin in the 2015 season-opener and 148 against Georgia on Oct. 3. 
266 Consecutive games without being shut out for Tennessee, the second-longest streak in SEC history and 10th-longest in major-college history. Tennessee's most recent shutout came 31-0 to Florida on Sept. 17, 1994. 
375 Interception-return yards for Alabama this season, the most in the nation. The Crimson Tide has 102 more interception-return yards than any other team and has run back four of its 12 interceptions for TDs. Alabama SS Eddie Jackson leads the nation with 230 interception-return yards this season.
